title: Elizabeth Cruz Portfolio
text:
MBA Candidate| Chemical Engineer| Operations Management Professional
About me:
Chemical Engineering Professional completing an MBA in Operations Management, with 5+ years of experience in process optimization, operational excellence, supply chain coordination, and quality assurance. Skilled in auditing, project management, and safety compliance, with a proven track record in cost reduction and workflow efficiency. Recognized for leading cross-functional teams, mentoring staff, and driving continuous improvement to enhance organizational performance.

title: Elizabeth Cruz Portfolio
text:
Professional Highlights

Campus Support Ambassador | University Canada West – Vancouver BC (Sept 2025-present)
Supported a diverse student body of 14,000+ and 244 staff, directly enhancing campus operational efficiency and overall satisfaction.

Ensure classroom and facility safety compliance, cleanliness, and efficient use of resources while coordinating logistics for classrooms, supplies, and technical assets to optimize workflows.
Act as floor warden and emergency responder, implementing safety protocols, guiding evacuations. Recommended data-driven process improvements to support continuous operational enhancements.



Administrative Director | Institute of Dental Prosthetics – San Luis Potosí, Mexico (2021–2024)
Directed operations for 200+ students and 20 staff, driving efficiency, compliance, and business growth.

Optimized workflows, internal controls, and supply chain processes, reducing financial losses by 50%, increasing efficiency by 30%, and improving compliance through audits and data-driven decisions.
Led a successful CAD $50,000 lab investment project and secured 2024 government accreditation by managing audits, regulatory processes, and cost control.
Built partnerships with 50+ organizations, launching a job placement program that enhanced reputation, student employability, and operational excellence.



Operations Manager | Institute of Vocational Training – San Luis Potosí, Mexico (2019–2021)
Directed campus operations for 100+ students and 10 faculty members, enhancing efficiency, compliance, and student/staff experience.

Redesigned admissions and academic record processes, cutting document turnaround time by 40%, streamlining operations, and implementing financial tracking and internal controls to prevent losses and support data-driven decisions.
Optimized staff schedules, classroom setups, and campus events, achieving 99% student and staff satisfaction while launching marketing and outreach campaigns that increased program visibility and enrollment by 50%, enabling a 30% staff salary increase.
Developed operational manuals and compliance procedures, ensuring regulatory alignment and achieving 100% audit approval.

title: ELIZABETH CRUZ PORTFOLIO
text:
Appendix by ChatGPT
✅ OUTLINE FOR ONE-PAGE MBA STUDENT PORTFOLIO
Header with Name and Contact Info
Full Name
LinkedIn, Email, Optional: Phone, Location, Professional Headshot
About Me (Professional Summary)
2–4 sentence overview of background, values, and goals
Education
MBA program details (school, concentration, GPA if strong)
Previous degrees (BBA, BA, etc.)
Professional Experience
2–3 key roles: title, company, location, years
One-line impact statement or achievement per role
Selected Projects
2–3 academic or professional projects relevant to business
Focus on leadership, analytics, innovation, or collaboration
Skills & Certifications
Business, tech, soft skills (Excel, Tableau, Financial Modeling, Leadership, etc.)
Certifications (Google, Coursera, LinkedIn Learning, etc.)
Languages / Volunteering / Personal Interests (Optional)
The LLM model provided an early system of skeleton in the organization and adjustment of the voice of this portfolio. However, I did some major edits to make the offered information exactly correspond to my written work experiences and achievements. I changed the generic placeholders with specific and factual explanation of my duties at Sanitas, GM Financial and Nueva EPS. To make my business role stronger, I incorporated objective results including earning more than 6.5 million commissions and exceeding KPIs by 105 percent. Moreover, I updated the personal bio to emphasize my passion of both leadership and digital transformation. To increase genuine and professional tone I have used a professional photograph and provided technical skills and language that are relevant to my career goals in Canada. Hence, despite the great creative backbone provided by the LLM, the final version replicates my authorial voice, professional path as well as strategic location.
